IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: To receive, administer, and distribute funds and property exclusively in furtherance of the educational activities and objectives of Christopher Newport University.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO RECEIVE, ADMINISTER, AND DISTRIBUTE FUNDS AND PROPERTY EXCLUSIVELY IN FURTHERANCE OF THE EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES AND OBJECTIVES OF CHRISTOPHER NEWPORT UNIVERSITY.
IRS990.Description: University Support-Educational expenses given as direct support to Christopher Newport University.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Paintings, sculptures, and historical artifacts that aid the University in its educational mission.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Provide scholarships, awards and operational assistance for the University.
SCH D, PAGE 4, PART XI, LINE 8: INTERFUND TRANSFER- ($1,000,000) SCH D, PAGE 4, PART XII LINE 2D AND XII LINE 2d: MERCHANDISE EXPENSE-$1514

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Other assistance is provided to the University in the form of scholarship support for students. Individual scholarship awards are based on specific criteria contained within annual and endowed scholarship agreements with the donor. Individual students meeting the criteria are identified by the University and award letters are generated. The organization receives the award letter and generates a check which is deposited to the student's account. Other assistance as other University support is provided to the University by disbursing donated funds to various educational activities of the University. These disbursements require documentation stating the reason for the disbursement and are approved by a supervisor knowledgeable about the activity requesting the funding.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Each member of the board received a PDF copy of the tax return through e-mail.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Annually, directors must disclose interest that could give rise to conflict. If a conflict arises, it is documented in the minutes and any vote requires abstinence of the affected board member.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization's governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements are not made available to the public.
The audit committee meets at least twice a year. Annually, the independent auditors present the audited financial statements and management report to the audit committee.

NameOfDisregardedEntity.BusinessNameLine1: Christopher Newport University Real Estate Foundation Inc
